sen.j: 成り木責め（なりきぜめ）とは、カキノキ、クリ、ウメなど果樹（成り木）について行なわれる豊作祈願の習俗である。
sen.e: Nariki-zeme (nariki, which is written as 成り木, means fruit bearing trees, and 責め, which in this case is pronounced 'zeme', is a noun form of 責める (semeru) which in this context means to press a tree for fruition) is a folk rite praying for a good harvest, conducted on such fruit trees as persimmon, chestnut and ume.

sen.e: Another person playing the fruit tree, who is often a child, replies, "I will, I will." and promises a good harvest.
